Detailed Description

It contains the configuration for the client if (profile == NULL) the configuration must be loaded else the configuration has already been loaded

Definition at line 219 of file client_config.h.

Field Documentation

struct actual_config_s client_config_coll_s::actconf

It contains the subset of actual configuration for this client

Definition at line 247 of file client_config.h.

GMutex client_config_coll_s::mutex

This mutex is used to assure only the first thread load the configuration for all the following threads. It must be statically initialized because this code is a library fetched by something else.

Definition at line 225 of file client_config.h.

int client_config_coll_s::mutex_cleared

The mutex has been already cleared and should not cleared again

Definition at line 229 of file client_config.h.

char* client_config_coll_s::profile

Transactional profile associated to the threads of this process (it must be an heap allocated variable)

Definition at line 272 of file client_config.h.

GPtrArray* client_config_coll_s::rsrmgrs

Resource managers' configuration. It must be an array of pointers because the item are referenced by "actconf"

Definition at line 268 of file client_config.h.

struct sockaddr_in client_config_coll_s::serv_addr

These are the parameters will be used by all the clients of this process to reach the transaction manager. This structure is filled once, and all the connection from all the thread inside the same process, are using it: 1 process -> 1 value for environment variabile LIXA_PROFILE -> 1 transaction manager will serve It's useless to resolve the transaction manager address every time a client want to connect to it. If the DNS is updated, the client process must be recycled in order to reach the server process (transaction manager): this is not so strange.

Definition at line 286 of file client_config.h.

State servers' configuration
